CEGAGraphicsGalaxy.cpp

00001 /*
00002  * CEGAGraphics.cpp
00003  *
00004  *  Created on: 27.12.2009
00005  *      Author: gerstrong
00006  *
00007  *  Decompression and decoding routine for
00008  *  Commander Keen Galaxy Series.
00009  *  EGAHEAD and EGADICT are normally files that have been embedded
00010  *  into the executable.
00011  *  EGAGRAPH is a seperate file which contains the graphics itself
00012  *  All thre files are needed to extract the graphics
00013  */

00033 // The ExeImageSize fields are values from the real start of exe image,
00034 // i.e. KEEN4E.EXE + 0x2E00 to EndOfFile=0x3D740
00035 // It seems that the standard shareware KDREAMS.EXE starts at 0x1C00
00036 
00037 static EpisodeInfoStruct EpisodeInfo[] = {
00038  { /* Episode 4 */
00039   0x3D740, /* ExeImageSize */
00040   0x21080, /* OffEgaHead */
00041   0x358F6, /* OffEgaDict */
00042   4751,  /* NumChunks */
00043   3, 3,  /* NumFonts, IndexFonts */
00044   115, 6,  /* NumBitmaps, IndexBitmaps */
00045   3, 121,  /* NumMaskedBitmaps, IndexMasked Bitmaps */
00046   397, 124, /* NumSprites, IndexSprites */
00047   104, 521, /* Num8Tiles, Index8Tiles */
00048   20, 522, /* Num8MaskedTiles, Index8MaskedTiles */
00049   1296, 523, /* Num16Tiles, Index16Tiles */
00050   2916, 1819, /* Num16MaskedTiles, Index16MaskedTiles */
00051   4, 4735, /* NumMisc, IndexMisc */
00052   7, 4739, /* NumTexts, IndexTexts */
00053   5, 4746  /* NumDemos, IndexDemos */
00054  },
00055  { /* Episode 5 */
00056   0x3E370, /* ExeImageSize */
00057   0x21FC0, /* OffEgaHead */
00058   0x362C4, /* OffEgaDict */
00059   4931,  /* NumChunks */
00060   3, 3,  /* NumFonts, IndexFonts */
00061   93, 6,  /* NumBitmaps, IndexBitmaps */
00062   3, 99,  /* NumMaskedBitmaps, IndexMasked Bitmaps */
00063   346, 102, /* NumSprites, IndexSprites */
00064   104, 448, /* Num8Tiles, Index8Tiles */
00065   20, 449, /* Num8MaskedTiles, Index8MaskedTiles */
00066   1512, 450, /* Num16Tiles, Index16Tiles */
00067   2952, 1962, /* Num16MaskedTiles, Index16MaskedTiles */

00069   7, 4914, /* NumTexts, IndexTexts */

00090   // The following ExeImageSize = KDREAMS.EXE (213536) - 0x1C00:
00091   206368,  /* ExeImageSize */

00112 /**
00113  * \brief This creates the class for reading the graphical
00114  * \param episode  Episode of the chosen game
00115  * \param path  Path to where the game is found on the media
00116  * \param ExeFile  Object to ExeFile in which the
00117  */
00118 CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::CEGAGraphicsGalaxy(CExeFile &ExeFile) :
00119 CEGAGraphics(ExeFile.getEpisode(), ExeFile.getDataDirectory()),
00120 m_Exefile(ExeFile)
00121 {
00122  createBitmapsIDs();
00123 }

00127 short CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::getNumTiles()

00130 /**
00131  * \brief load the data into the structure
00132  * \return  returns true, if loading was successful
00133  */
00134 bool CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::loadData()
00135 {
00136  // Set the palette, so the proper colours are loaded
00137  g_pGfxEngine->Palette.setupColorPalettes(m_Exefile.getRawData(), m_episode);
00138 
00139  if(!begin()) return false;
00140 
00141  // First, retrieve the Tile properties so the tilemap gets properly formatted
00142  // Important especially for masks, and later in the game for the behaviours
00143     // of those objects
00144  CTileLoader TileLoader( m_Exefile );
00145  if(!TileLoader.load(EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].Num16Tiles,
00146       EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].Num16MaskedTiles))
00147   return false;
00148 
00149  if(!readfonts()) return false;
00150  if(!readBitmaps()) return false;
00151  if(!readMaskedBitmaps()) return false;
00152 
00153  g_pGfxEngine->createEmptyTilemap(4);
00154 
00155  if(!readTilemaps(EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].Num16Tiles, 4, 18,
00156    EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].Index16Tiles,
00157    g_pGfxEngine->getTileMap(0), false)) return false;
00158  if(!readMaskedTilemaps(EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].Num16MaskedTiles, 4, 18,
00159    EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].Index16MaskedTiles,
00160    g_pGfxEngine->getTileMap(1), false)) return false;
00161  if(!readTilemaps(EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].Num8Tiles, 3, 1,
00162    EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].Index8Tiles,
00163    g_pGfxEngine->getTileMap(2), true)) return false;
00164  if(!readMaskedTilemaps(EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].Num8MaskedTiles, 3, 1,
00165    EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].Index8MaskedTiles,
00166    g_pGfxEngine->getTileMap(3), true)) return false;
00167  if(!readSprites( EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].NumSprites,
00168    EpisodeInfo[m_episode-4].IndexSprites )) return false;
00169  //k456_export_texts();
00170  //k456_export_misc();
00171  //k456_export_demos();
00172  //k456_export_end();
00173 
00174  return true;
00175 }

00177 /**
00178  * \brief  This function extracts a picture from the galaxy graphics map, and converts it properly to a
00179  *    SDL Surface
00180  */
00181 void CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::extractPicture(SDL_Surface *sfc,
00182   std::vector<unsigned char> &data, size_t Width, size_t Height,
00183   bool masked)
00184 {
00185  if(SDL_MUSTLOCK(sfc)) SDL_LockSurface(sfc);
00186  SDL_FillRect(sfc, NULL, 0x00);
00187 
00188  if(!data.empty())
00189  {
00190   // Decode the bitmap data
00191   for(size_t p = 0; p < 4; p++)
00192   {
00193    unsigned char *pointer;
00194    Uint8* pixel = (Uint8*) sfc->pixels;
00195 
00196    // get location of plane p
00197    if(masked)
00198    {
00199     pointer = &(data[0]) + (p+1) * Width * Height;
00200 
00201     // now try to extract the bits and pass it to the SDL-Surface
00202     for(size_t y = 0; y < Height; y++)
00203     {
00204      for(size_t x = 0; x < Width; x++)
00205      {
00206       Uint8 bit,b;
00207       for(b=0 ; b<8 ; b++)
00208       {
00209        bit = getBit(*pointer, 7-b);
00210        *pixel |= (bit<<p);
00211        pixel++;
00212       }
00213       pointer++;
00214      }
00215     }
00216    }
00217    else
00218    {
00219     pointer = &(data[0]) + p * Width * Height;
00220 
00221     // now try to extract the bits and pass it to the SDL-Surface
00222     for(size_t y = 0; y < Height; y++)
00223     {
00224      for(size_t x = 0; x < Width; x++)
00225      {
00226       Uint8 bit,b;
00227       for(b=0 ; b<8 ; b++)
00228       {
00229        bit = getBit(*pointer, 7-b);
00230        *pixel |= (bit<<p);
00231        pixel++;
00232       }
00233       pointer++;
00234      }
00235     }
00236    }
00237   }
00238 
00239   if(masked)
00240   {
00241    // This stuff is for reading the mask and apply it to the pixel map
00242    unsigned char *pointer = &(data[0]);
00243    Uint8* pixel = (Uint8*) sfc->pixels;
00244 
00245    // now try to extract the bits and pass it to the SDL-Surface
00246    for(size_t y = 0; y < Height; y++)
00247    {
00248     for(size_t x = 0; x < Width; x++)
00249     {
00250      Uint8 bit,b;
00251      for(b=0 ; b<8 ; b++)
00252      {
00253       bit = getBit(*pointer, 7-b);
00254       if(bit == 1)
00255        *pixel = 16;
00256 
00257       pixel++;
00258      }
00259      pointer++;
00260     }
00261    }
00262   }
00263  }
00264 }
00265 
00266 /**
00267  * \brief  This function extracts a tile from the galaxy graphics map, and converts it properly to a
00268  *    SDL Surface
00269  */
00270 void CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::extractTile(SDL_Surface *sfc, std::vector<unsigned char> &data,
00271   Uint16 size, Uint16 columns, size_t tile, bool usetileoffset)
00272 {
00273  if(!data.empty())
00274  {
00275   // Decode the image data
00276   for(size_t p = 0; p < 4; p++)
00277   {
00278    // Decode the lines of the bitmap data
00279    size_t tileoff = usetileoffset ? (tile*4*columns*(size/8)*size) : 0;
00280    Uint8 *pointer = &(data[0]) + tileoff + p * (size/8) * size;
00281    for(size_t y = 0; y < size; y++)
00282    {
00283     Uint8 *pixel = (Uint8*)sfc->pixels +
00284       size*(tile%columns) +
00285       size*size*columns*(tile/columns) +
00286       (size*columns*y);
00287     for(size_t x = 0; x < (size/8); x++)
00288     {
00289      Uint8 bit,b;
00290      for(b=0 ; b<8 ; b++)
00291      {
00292       bit = getBit(*pointer, 7-b);
00293       *pixel |= (bit<<p);
00294       pixel++;
00295      }
00296      pointer++;
00297     }
00298    }
00299 
00300   }
00301  }
00302 }
00303 
00304 /**
00305  * \brief  This function extracts a tile from the galaxy graphics map, and converts it properly to a
00306  *    SDL Surface
00307  */
00308 void CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::extractMaskedTile(SDL_Surface *sfc, std::vector<unsigned char> &data,
00309   Uint16 size, Uint16 columns, size_t tile, bool usetileoffset)
00310 {
00311  if(!data.empty())
00312  {
00313   // Decode the image data
00314   size_t tileoff = usetileoffset ? (tile*5*columns*(size/8)*size) : 0;
00315   for(size_t p = 0; p < 4; p++)
00316   {
00317    // Decode the lines of the bitmap data
00318    Uint8 *pointer = &(data[0]) + tileoff + (p+1) * (size/8) * size;
00319    for(size_t y = 0; y < size; y++)
00320    {
00321     Uint8 *pixel = (Uint8*)sfc->pixels +
00322       size*(tile%columns) +
00323       size*size*columns*(tile/columns) +
00324       (size*columns*y);
00325     for(size_t x = 0; x < (size/8); x++)
00326     {
00327      Uint8 bit,b;
00328      for(b=0 ; b<8 ; b++)
00329      {
00330       bit = getBit(*pointer, 7-b);
00331       *pixel |= (bit<<p);
00332       pixel++;
00333      }
00334      pointer++;
00335     }
00336    }
00337   }
00338 
00339   // now apply the mask!
00340   Uint8 *pointer = &(data[0]) + tileoff;
00341   for(size_t y = 0; y < size; y++)
00342   {
00343    Uint8 *pixel = (Uint8*)sfc->pixels +
00344      size*(tile%columns) +
00345      size*size*columns*(tile/columns) +
00346      (size*columns*y);
00347    for(size_t x = 0; x < (size/8); x++)
00348    {
00349     Uint8 bit,b;
00350     for(b=0 ; b<8 ; b++)
00351     {
00352      bit = getBit(*pointer, 7-b);
00353      if(bit == 1)
00354       *pixel = 16;
00355      pixel++;
00356     }
00357     pointer++;
00358    }
00359   }
00360  }
00361 }
00362 
00363 /**
00364  * \brief prepares to load the data. Does a bit of extraction
00365  * \return  returns true, if loading was successful
00366  */
00367 bool CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::begin()
00368 {
00369  // The stuff is Huffman compressed. Use an instance for that
00370  CHuffman Huffman;
00371  unsigned long exeheaderlen = 0;
00372  unsigned long exeimglen = 0;
00373  assert(m_episode >= 4);
00374  int ep = m_episode - 4; // index for EpisodeInfo; 0 - keen4, 1 - keen5, etc
00375 
00376  unsigned char *p_data = m_Exefile.getHeaderData();
00377 
00378  //if(m_episode == 7) exeheaderlen = HEADERLEN_KDREAMS;
00379  if(!m_Exefile.readExeImageSize( p_data, &exeimglen, &exeheaderlen))
00380   return false;
00381 
00382  // We need the EGADICT. Read it to our structure of Huffman, he needs it!
00383  Huffman.readDictionary(p_data, exeheaderlen + EpisodeInfo[ep].OffEgaDict);
00384 
00385  // Now we go to EGAHEAD
00386  // TODO: Implement a structure which will look for the files first and take them if possible
00387 
00388  // Read the EGAHEAD
00389  unsigned char *p_head = p_data + exeheaderlen + EpisodeInfo[ep].OffEgaHead;
00390  unsigned long offset = 0;
00391  unsigned long offset_limit;
00392 
00393  // For some reason, MultiMania's KDR support uses a slightly different limit
00394  // in offset ops. We're not in DOS, so we don't have to worry about
00395  // memory here >:P
00396  if (ep < 3) offset_limit = 0x00FFFFFF;
00397  else offset_limit = 0xFFFFFFFF;
00398 
00399  for(size_t i = 0 ; i < EpisodeInfo[ep].NumChunks ; i++)
00400  {
00401   if (ep != 3) {
00402    memcpy(&offset, p_head,3); // Keen 4-6
00403    p_head += 3;
00404    offset &= offset_limit;
00405   }
00406   else {
00407    memcpy(&offset, p_head,4); // KeenDreams
00408    p_head += 4;
00409   }
00410   m_egahead.push_back(offset);
00411  }
00412 
00413  // Now read the EGAGRAPH
00414  std::string filename;
00415  if (m_episode <= 6) filename =  m_path + "EGAGRAPH.CK" + itoa(m_episode);
00416  else filename =  m_path + "KDREAMS.EGA";
00417 
00418  std::ifstream File; OpenGameFileR(File, filename, std::ios::binary);
00419 
00420  if(!File)
00421  {
00422   g_pLogFile->textOut(RED,"Error the file \"" + filename + "\" is missing or can't be read!");
00423   return false;
00424  }
00425 
00426  size_t egagraphlen = 0;
00427  File.seekg(1,std::ios::end);
00428  egagraphlen = File.tellg();
00429  if(egagraphlen == 0)
00430  {
00431   g_pLogFile->textOut(RED,"Error the file \"" + filename + "\" is empty!");
00432   return false;
00433  }
00434  egagraphlen--;
00435  File.seekg(0,std::ios::beg);
00436 
00437  std::vector<unsigned char> CompEgaGraphData(egagraphlen);
00438  File.read((char*)&CompEgaGraphData[0], egagraphlen);
00439 
00440  // Make a clean memory pattern
00441  ChunkStruct ChunkTemplate;
00442  ChunkTemplate.len=0;
00443  m_egagraph.assign(EpisodeInfo[ep].NumChunks, ChunkTemplate);
00444 
00445  unsigned long inlen = 0, outlen = 0;
00446 
00447  // Now lets decompress the graphics
00448  for(size_t i = 0; i < EpisodeInfo[ep].NumChunks; i++)
00449  {
00450   // Show that something is happening
00451   offset = m_egahead[i];
00452   
00453   // Make sure the chunk is valid
00454   if(offset < offset_limit && offset + 4 <= CompEgaGraphData.size())
00455   {
00456    // Get the expanded length of the chunk
00457    if(i >= EpisodeInfo[ep].Index8Tiles && i < EpisodeInfo[ep].Index16MaskedTiles + EpisodeInfo[ep].Num16MaskedTiles)
00458    {
00459     // Expanded sizes of 8, 16,and 32 tiles are implicit
00460     if(i >= EpisodeInfo[ep].Index16MaskedTiles) // 16x16 tiles are one/chunk
00461      outlen = 2 * 16 * 5;
00462     else if(i >= EpisodeInfo[ep].Index16Tiles)
00463      outlen = 2 * 16 * 4;
00464     else if(i >= EpisodeInfo[ep].Index8MaskedTiles) // 8x8 tiles are all in one chunk!
00465      outlen = EpisodeInfo[ep].Num8MaskedTiles * 8 * 5;
00466     else if(i >= EpisodeInfo[ep].Index8Tiles)
00467      outlen = EpisodeInfo[ep].Num8Tiles * 8 * 4;
00468    }
00469    else
00470    {
00471     memcpy(&outlen, &CompEgaGraphData[offset], 4);
00472     offset += 4;
00473    }
00474 
00475    // Allocate memory and decompress the chunk
00476    m_egagraph[i].len = outlen;
00477    m_egagraph[i].data.assign(outlen, 0);
00478 
00479    inlen = 0;
00480    // Find out the input length
00481    size_t j;
00482    for(j = i + 1; j < EpisodeInfo[ep].NumChunks; j++)
00483    {
00484     if(m_egahead[j] != offset_limit)
00485     {
00486      inlen = m_egahead[j] - offset;
00487      break;
00488     }
00489    }
00490    if(j == EpisodeInfo[ep].NumChunks)
00491     inlen = egagraphlen - offset;
00492    Huffman.expand(&CompEgaGraphData[offset], &m_egagraph[i].data[0], inlen, outlen);
00493   }
00494   else
00495   {
00496    m_egagraph[i].len = 0;
00497   }
00498  }
00499 
00500  // Set up pointers to bitmap and sprite tables if not doing KDR operations
00501  //if (ep < 4) {
00502   //BmpHead = (BitmapHeadStruct *)m_egagraph[0].data;
00503   //BmpMaskedHead = (BitmapHeadStruct *)m_EgaGraph[1].data;
00504   //SprHead = (SpriteHeadStruct *)m_EgaGraph[2].data;
00505  //}
00506 
00507  File.close();
00508  return true;
00509 }
00510 
00511 /**
00512  * \brief This function gets the bit of an unsigned char variable at certain position
00513  * \param data  variable where the bit is to be sent.
00514  * \param leftshift sets the position of the bit the function has to retrieve
00515  * \return  returns 1, if the bit at position is one, else 0
00516  */
00517 Uint8 CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::getBit(unsigned char data, Uint8 leftshift)
00518 {
00519  Uint8 value;
00520 
00521  value = data & (1<<leftshift);
00522  value >>= leftshift;
00523 
00524  return value;
00525 }
00526 
00527 /**
00528  * \brief Read the fonts to the Gfx-Engine
00529  * \return  returns true, if the fonts were read successfully, else false
00530  */
00531 bool CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::readfonts()
00532 {
00533  int bw, y, x;
00534 
00535  int ep = m_episode - 4;
00536  SDL_Color *Palette = g_pGfxEngine->Palette.m_Palette;
00537 
00538  g_pGfxEngine->createEmptyFontmaps(EpisodeInfo[ep].NumFonts);
00539  for(Uint16 i = 0; i < EpisodeInfo[ep].NumFonts; i++)
00540  {
00541   CFont &Font = g_pGfxEngine->getFont(i);
00542   Font.setMonochrome(true);
00543 
00544   if(m_egagraph.at(EpisodeInfo[ep].IndexFonts + i).data.at(0))
00545   {
00546    FontHeadStruct *FontHead =
00547      (FontHeadStruct*) &(m_egagraph.at(EpisodeInfo[ep].IndexFonts + i).data.at(0));
00548 
00549    // Find out the maximum character width
00550    int maxwidth=0;
00551    for(Uint16 j = 0; j < 256; j++)
00552    {
00553     Font.setWidthToCharacter(FontHead->Width[j],j);
00554     if(FontHead->Width[j] > maxwidth)
00555      maxwidth = FontHead->Width[j];
00556    }
00557 
00558    Font.CreateSurface(Palette, g_pVideoDriver->getScrollSurface()->flags, 8, maxwidth*16, FontHead->Height * 16);
00559 
00560    SDL_Surface* sfc = Font.getSDLSurface();
00561 
00562    SDL_FillRect(sfc, NULL, 0x8);
00563 
00564    if(SDL_MUSTLOCK(sfc)) SDL_LockSurface(sfc);
00565    Uint8* pixel = (Uint8*) sfc->pixels;
00566 
00567    unsigned char *pointer = &(m_egagraph[EpisodeInfo[ep].IndexFonts + i].data.at(0));
00568 
00569    if(!m_egagraph.at(EpisodeInfo[ep].IndexFonts + i).data.empty())
00570    {
00571     // Decode the font data
00572     for(int j = 0; j < 256; j++)
00573     {
00574      // Get the width of the character in bytes
00575      bw = (FontHead->Width[j] + 7) / 8;
00576 
00577      Uint8 *pixelpos;
00578 
00579      if(FontHead->Width[j] > 0)
00580      {
00581       SDL_Rect rect;
00582 
00583       rect.x = (j%16)*maxwidth;
00584       rect.y = (j/16)*FontHead->Height;
00585       rect.w = FontHead->Width[j];
00586       rect.h = FontHead->Height;
00587 
00588       for( y = 0 ; y < rect.h ; y++ )
00589       {
00590        pixelpos = pixel + (rect.y+y)*sfc->pitch+rect.x;
00591        for( x = 0 ; x < rect.w ; x++ )
00592        {
00593         pixelpos[x] = getBit(*(pointer + FontHead->Offset[j] + (y*bw) + x/8 ), 7-(x%8) )*0xF;
00594        }
00595       }
00596      }
00597     }
00598    }
00599    SDL_UnlockSurface(sfc);
00600   }
00601  }
00602  return true;
00603 }
00604 
00605 /**
00606  * \brief This one extracts the bitmaps used in Keen 4-6 (Maybe Dreams in future)
00607  * \return  returns true, if the fonts were read successfully, else false
00608  */
00609 bool CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::readBitmaps()
00610 {
00611  int ep = m_episode - 4;
00612  BitmapHeadStruct *BmpHead = (BitmapHeadStruct *) &(m_egagraph.at(0).data.at(0));
00613  SDL_Color *Palette = g_pGfxEngine->Palette.m_Palette;
00614 
00615  g_pGfxEngine->createEmptyBitmaps(EpisodeInfo[ep].NumBitmaps);
00616 
00617  for(size_t i = 0; i < EpisodeInfo[ep].NumBitmaps; i++)
00618  {
00619   CBitmap &Bitmap = g_pGfxEngine->getBitmap(i);
00620   Bitmap.setDimensions(BmpHead[i].Width*8, BmpHead[i].Height);
00621   Bitmap.createSurface(g_pVideoDriver->getScrollSurface()->flags, Palette);
00622 
00623   extractPicture(Bitmap.getSDLSurface(),
00624     m_egagraph.at(EpisodeInfo[ep].IndexBitmaps + i).data,
00625     BmpHead[i].Width, BmpHead[i].Height);
00626 
00627 
00628   Bitmap.setName(m_BitmapNameMap[ep][i]);
00629  }
00630 
00631  return true;
00632 }
00633 
00634 bool CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::readMaskedBitmaps()
00635 {
00636  int ep = m_episode - 4;
00637  BitmapHeadStruct *BmpMaskedHead = (BitmapHeadStruct *) &(m_egagraph.at(1).data.at(0));
00638  SDL_Color *Palette = g_pGfxEngine->Palette.m_Palette;
00639 
00640  g_pGfxEngine->createEmptyMaskedBitmaps(EpisodeInfo[ep].NumMaskedBitmaps);
00641 
00642  for(size_t i = 0; i < EpisodeInfo[ep].NumMaskedBitmaps; i++)
00643  {
00644   CBitmap &Bitmap = g_pGfxEngine->getMaskedBitmap(i);
00645   Bitmap.setDimensions(BmpMaskedHead[i].Width*8, BmpMaskedHead[i].Height);
00646   Bitmap.createSurface(g_pVideoDriver->getScrollSurface()->flags, Palette);
00647 
00648   extractPicture(Bitmap.getSDLSurface(),
00649     m_egagraph.at(EpisodeInfo[ep].IndexMaskedBitmaps + i).data,
00650     BmpMaskedHead[i].Width, BmpMaskedHead[i].Height, true);
00651  }
00652  return true;
00653 }
00654 
00655 bool CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::readTilemaps( size_t NumTiles, size_t pbasetilesize,
00656           size_t rowlength, size_t IndexOfTiles,
00657           CTilemap &Tilemap, bool tileoff)
00658 {
00659  Tilemap.CreateSurface( g_pGfxEngine->Palette.m_Palette, SDL_SWSURFACE,
00660        NumTiles, pbasetilesize, rowlength );
00661  SDL_Surface *sfc = Tilemap.getSDLSurface();
00662  SDL_FillRect(sfc,NULL, 0);
00663  if(SDL_MUSTLOCK(sfc)) SDL_LockSurface(sfc);
00664 
00665  for(size_t i = 0; i < NumTiles; i++)
00666  {
00667   extractTile(sfc, m_egagraph.at(IndexOfTiles + (tileoff ? 0 : i)).data, (1<<pbasetilesize), rowlength, i, tileoff);
00668  }
00669 
00670  SDL_UnlockSurface(sfc);
00671 
00672  return true;
00673 }
00674 
00675 bool CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::readMaskedTilemaps( size_t NumTiles, size_t pbasetilesize,
00676            size_t rowlength, size_t IndexOfTiles,
00677            CTilemap &Tilemap, bool tileoff)
00678 {
00679  Tilemap.CreateSurface( g_pGfxEngine->Palette.m_Palette, SDL_SWSURFACE,
00680        NumTiles, pbasetilesize, rowlength );
00681  SDL_Surface *sfc = Tilemap.getSDLSurface();
00682  SDL_FillRect(sfc,NULL, 0);
00683  if(SDL_MUSTLOCK(sfc)) SDL_LockSurface(sfc);
00684 
00685  for(size_t i = 0; i < NumTiles; i++)
00686  {
00687   extractMaskedTile(sfc, m_egagraph.at(IndexOfTiles + (tileoff ? 0 : i)).data, (1<<pbasetilesize), rowlength, i, tileoff);
00688  }
00689 
00690  SDL_UnlockSurface(sfc);
00691 
00692  return true;
00693 }
00694 
00695 bool CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::readSprites( size_t NumSprites, size_t IndexSprite )
00696 {
00697  // Create all the sprites
00698  g_pGfxEngine->createEmptySprites(NumSprites);
00699 
00700  SpriteHeadStruct *SprHead = (SpriteHeadStruct *)&(m_egagraph.at(2).data.at(0));
00701 
00702  for(size_t i = 0; i < NumSprites; i++)
00703  {
00704   SpriteHeadStruct Head = SprHead[i];
00705   std::vector<unsigned char> &data = m_egagraph.at(IndexSprite + i).data;
00706 
00707   CSprite &Sprite = g_pGfxEngine->getSprite(i);
00708   Sprite.setSize( Head.Width*8, Head.Height );
00709 
00710   // Setup the collision information
00711   Uint16 boxX1 = ((Head.Rx1 - Head.OrgX) << (STC-Head.Shifts));
00712   Uint16 boxY1 = ((Head.Ry1 - Head.OrgY) << (STC-Head.Shifts));
00713   Uint16 boxX2 = ((Head.Rx2 - Head.OrgX) << (STC-Head.Shifts));
00714   Uint16 boxY2 = ((Head.Ry2 - Head.OrgY) << (STC-Head.Shifts));
00715 
00716   Sprite.setBouncingBoxCoordinates( boxX1, boxY1, boxX2, boxY2 );
00717 
00718 
00719   Sprite.createSurface( g_pVideoDriver->BlitSurface->flags,
00720     g_pGfxEngine->Palette.m_Palette );
00721 
00722   SDL_Surface *sfc = Sprite.getSDLSurface();
00723   SDL_FillRect(sfc,NULL, 0);
00724   if(SDL_MUSTLOCK(sfc)) SDL_LockSurface(sfc);
00725 
00726   if(!data.empty())
00727   {
00728    // Decode the image data
00729    for(size_t p = 0; p < 4; p++)
00730    {
00731     // Decode the lines of the bitmap data
00732     Uint8 *pointer = &(data[0]) + (p+1) * Head.Width * Head.Height;
00733     for(size_t y = 0; y < Head.Height; y++)
00734     {
00735      Uint8 *pixel = (Uint8*)sfc->pixels +
00736        (Head.Width * 8 *y);
00737      for(size_t x = 0; x < Head.Width; x++)
00738      {
00739       Uint8 bit,b;
00740       for(b=0 ; b<8 ; b++)
00741       {
00742        bit = getBit(*pointer, 7-b);
00743        *pixel |= (bit<<p);
00744        pixel++;
00745       }
00746       pointer++;
00747      }
00748     }
00749    }
00750 
00751    // now apply the mask!
00752    Uint8 *pointer = &(data[0]);
00753    for(size_t y = 0; y < Head.Height; y++)
00754    {
00755     Uint8 *pixel = (Uint8*)sfc->pixels +
00756       (Head.Width * 8*y);
00757     for(size_t x = 0; x < Head.Width; x++)
00758     {
00759      Uint8 bit,b;
00760      for(b=0 ; b<8 ; b++)
00761      {
00762       bit = getBit(*pointer, 7-b);
00763       if(bit == 1)
00764        *pixel = 16;
00765       pixel++;
00766      }
00767      pointer++;
00768     }
00769    }
00770   }
00771   SDL_UnlockSurface(sfc);
00772  }
00773  return true;
00774 }

00776 CEGAGraphicsGalaxy::~CEGAGraphicsGalaxy()
00777 {
00778 }
